column4: I have a laptop which currently has FC1 installed on it, and I'd like to install Ubuntu on to it. The system won't boot from the CD drive, and it has no floppy drive, ideas?
if it has no usb ports, its rather old, right?
how much RAM does it have?
it does not boot from cd at all or just not from the ubuntu cd?
Bios doesn't support booting from CD.
hmm. and no floppy either, thats bad. how was fc1 installed?
I put a minimal dos system on it, and then ran Fedoras install script off the cd.
and how did you install dos? what were you booting from?
floppy disk, the CD and Floppy share the same bay, so it is one or the other.
there is a boot manager (sbm) that can be installed to hard disk allowing to boot from cd even if the bios does not support it
SPM is in the repos, and the latest version no less!
